Germany: The Prussian king Frederick the Great issued an ultimatum to Austria demanding the cession of Silesia according to the terms of an inheritance treaty. Silesian Wars: Prussia invaded Silesia.
India: Raghoji I Bhonsle of the Maratha Empire defeats and kills Dost Ali Khan the Mughal Nawab of Arcot in the Battle of Damalcherry.
Indinesia: A massacre of Batavia's ethnic Chinese begins after they are suspected by the VOC of planning a rebellion. Approximately 10,000 are killed and the Chinese quarter is burned.
Ireland: Extreme winters in successive years result in poor harvests, causing a large scale famine in which between 300,000 and 480,000 die.
Russia:
Anna died of kidney disease. She left the throne to her adopted infant son, Ivan VI.
Anna's lover, Ernst Johann von Biron, was declared regent.
Biron was arrested on the orders of his rival, the Count Burkhard Christoph von Munnich. Ivan's biological mother, Anna Leopoldovna, replaced Biron as regent.
Taiwan: Legal migration to Taiwan is ended
Tajikistan: Nader Shah conquered the Janid Khanate.
